Reviews.Title: “For the price, you'd expect to be treated well....however, not the case.”
Reviews.Author: Nikkiv1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night in a deluxe room. The room was nothing special, in need of an updating for sure. The lady at the front desk was rude and unhelpful. When we asked her where to park our vehicle and if there was any underground parking in the vicinity, she just gave us a flat no. We had park outside and either pay $20 or wake up at 6am to put more money into the parking machine. The washroom had a half-used roll of toilet paper and the water in the shower came out as a trickle, even turned on full-blast. The room we had was beside a staircase and you could constantly hear people walking up and down the stairs as well as hear people walking around in the rooms above. Check-out was at 11am, and when I called the front desk at 10am to ask for a later check-out, no one answered. I kept calling until finally, someone picked up at 10:50am only to tell me that yes, late check-out is available, but the fee was $25. Even for an extra 30-60 minutes! There are much cheaper hotels that always give you a late check-out if there is no one else checking in. And on the day that we were checking out, I'm sure there wasn't a stream of people waiting to check in to this hotel. Just giving us the proper customer service was all that was needed, but that was neglected. We will never return to this hotel, and will advise friends to avoid it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: bandlh
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, rooms a little bit tired, but clean and hey, you're only there to sleep! Breakfast could be improved but was OK. Would we stay there again, probably.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely interior, quiet on the lower floor”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen_1418
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 103, below grade, but since I hoped to be able to sleep in the lack of light was welcome. It was listed as a king bed, but is really 2 twins pushed together with king size sheets, OK, but not my favourite solution. The room is smaller than most hotel rooms, but it had all the space we needed, the bathroom was an average size with nice amenities. The building itself was lovely, lots of wood paneling, decorative flowers, and a small shelf of books that could be read. Being an old house, stairs and some narrow corridors exist. I'd stay again! The subway was a distant rumble, quieter than many hotel rooms I've stayed in near busy roads or large fans.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SLLTA
Reviews.Content: Madison Manor Boutique Hotel is located near public transit, its primary asset. The room was OK. The bathroom was tiny and suitable only for a very short person. Breakfast was dreadful: cold, tasteless bagels, and such. I could hear the rumble of the Metro every few minutes. There are better choices and values.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal and great location”
Reviews.Author: netdepa
Reviews.Content: Have been here once only but was recommended by many people and friends. The hotel/B&B is located into a huge victorian house. So size and confort is a bit of the old times, but details and atmosphere is very nice. The location is also great, near Bloor/Spadina and all Toronto's amenities and public transit. Only sligthly negative sides are: the limited breakfast (but there is plenty of choice in the area) and some noise in the weekend (but you wanted to stay in downtown...). Also, be ready to deal with some stairs without elevator. Overall, I think it is very difficult to get a similar accomodation in an equivalent location, for the price they ask.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ellejam
Reviews.Content: This was a good place for a one-night stay for my husband and I while out with friends. The room we had faced the busy dive bar the Madison is known for, and it was somewhat loud up until 1 a.m. I drowned it out with the TV, though, so it was fine. Clean, plush rooms and reasonably sized bathrooms. Keep in mind that it's a walk-up, so getting to the room provided a bit of extra exercise; may not be suitable for older or disabled patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - not so good services”
Reviews.Author: Grospoppa
Reviews.Content: We has room 302, which had a little balcony overlooking Madison. It was a great place for a happy hour scotch. The people watching was fun and the nights were velvet. The Pub complex was interesting but the service was awful, My wife ordered a Hamburger and waited an hour. My meal was overcooked but tasted ok. The hotel also had screwed internet connections and when I tried to get the staff to fix it - it didn't happen. B.S. in this day of connectivity. We would stay there again but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Annex/University Area”
Reviews.Author: tutchone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night, while introducing a family member to the Bloor Street / Annex area and neighbourhood. While our room was not large by North American standards, it was more than adequate, and the place was clean (no bedbugs, which is a Toronto concern), with o.k. furnishings and a nice bathroom. A large pub (part of the same business) is located next door; we weren't disturbed by it, though perhaps this was because we stayed here on a Sunday night. We didn't partake of the included breakfast, preferring instead to sample the great neighbourhood fare. Overall I feel we received reasonable value for the cost charged.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Emily K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Toronto and the Madison Manor. We were very happy with our experience there. The room was clean and comfortable (although the decor is a little tired) and we were lucky to have a room that was far from the noise of the hotel's teeming bar. If you are a light sleeper and are planning a trip during the university semester, you might want to request a back room. The place gets PACKED with college kids, especially on weekends. But, we stayed in Room 203 and didn't hear a peep! The breakfast was nice and the location excellent-- lots of restaurants nearby and very close to the Spadina subway. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two rooms, and front desks”
Reviews.Author: Captain_No_Beard
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a difference a desk clerk and a room can make. We checked in mid afternoon, while the wife had a migraine, we go to the room to give her time for a nap before our evening appointment and it's 80 degrees in the room. Turn on the A/C and all it's doing is blowing hot air. Open the sliding door to let in the air, and we're 8 feet from the patio at the adjoining bar. Sit down to surf the internet while the wife lies down, no connection. Call the front desk, tell her, no AC no Internet...she tells me that she doesn't know about the internet and the AC is on, that's it. An hour later I go down to change out the Ethernet cable for the internet and mention the AC again, new staff..."Internet doesn't work in that room, the AC is a problem, can we move you?" Immediate move to a room at the other end of the hall, where the AC is great and the internet works like a charm! The rest of the stay is fine, nice room, great AC. A little noisy outside when the bars let out, but that's to be expected. Breakfast was nothing fancy, just the usual continental, with muffins, danish and bagels. Overall it was a fine place and the price isn't outrageous for the location. Don't stay in 408!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect alternative to a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: scs1207
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice before (2006 and 2009), and we're glad we came back. The hotel is situated in a converted victorian jouse in a residential street just off Bloor Street, with the Yonge-Bloor und University-Spadina subways and the Spadina streetcar only 2 minutes away. The rooms are comfortable and clean (we always stay in the basement studio because of the kitchenette), and included in the room rate is a basic continental breakfast which is served in the bar area of the adjacent Madison Avenue Pub. This is also where the office/front desk of the hotel is located. Staff are generally very friendly and accommodating. If you arrive later in the evening you have to find a member of the bar staff to check in, but that's usually no problem. Yes, it can get a little noisy on Friday and Saturday evenings when the pub is brim full of students partying away, but usually it's not that bad. All in all this hotel is a perfect alternative if you don't like impersonal chain hotels and want to stay at a place with a more homey feel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: R3gardl3ss
Reviews.Content: Nice, warm, comfortable feeling. As good as snuggling on your couch with a blanket, a hot chocolate, and a good book or movie!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff, excessive street noise.”
Reviews.Author: H0nestAl
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three weeks at this hotel with five colleagues for business. Although there are some positives, such as a clean room and reasonable rates, the negatives greatly outweigh them. Initially, the lack of an actual reception/office was offputting because we had to track down a bartender from the upstairs pub to check us in. Over the next few weeks, several of my colleague's electronic room keys stopped working (one had to get eight replacements), and each time it was past office hours and the bartender had to be found. No apology or solution was ever offered. In addition there is a continental breakfast included in the stay that is no more than stale bagels, oily muffins, and cold hard-boiled eggs. Breakfast is in the main floor of the pub, and several mornings by the time I made it to breakfast there was no food left and many of the tables were dirty and littered with used plateware. Lastly, after a few days of asking reception to call us a cab, we were told that "Y'know you can call it yourself. There's a phonebook in your room." After that helpful tip, the phone at reception was no longer answered when we called. Overall a very disappointing and frusterating experience.

Reviews.Title: “too noisy”
Reviews.Author: debriopelle
Reviews.Content: We reserved in January and requested a room that was quiet. They gave us a room that was facing the street and above the main entrance. The noises and voices we heard most of the night were so bad that we might as well have all been in the same room. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, comfy stay on New Years Eve.”
Reviews.Author: tpc2001
Reviews.Content: Just to add a little regarding people who have pointed out a noise concern: Ask for a basement room on the north side--you'll be fine. There was a large party next door for New Years Eve (cheapest NYE in Toronto BTW), Sweetie and I had a great/reasonably quiet night's sleep. Location is really convenient. Room was warm, clean, attractive. Bed was comfy, and we enjoyed the breakfast. Excellent deal for Toronto. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific alternative to chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel5654
Reviews.Content: Has a great time. Stayed in Suite that had a gas fireplace, lots of natural light. The place was very clean and quiet (North East side of building), the neightbour hood is somehwat historic and eccentric. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was what would be expected for this price range. Parking was convenient and the hotel is close to the subway and streetcar lines. A great experience and would definately stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetwotravel10
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Madison Manor. It is a great place to stay while in Toronto. Subway is just steps away from your door. Rooms are spacious and very clean. We stayed 2 nights and the second night we did hear the drunk crowd singing "Oh Canada" at 2:30am. It woke us up but it didn't bother us. We thought it was kinda cool really. Kathryn that runs the hotel is very friendly. We would definetly stay there again. The rates for the rooms are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique-Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lars1975
Reviews.Content: Wonderful renovated Victorian-Style Boutique-Hotel with about 20 rooms, all are lovely and cute. Very friendly staff: While she showed as soom rooms, the Deluxe room (which we preferred) was booked online, so we got the Suite for the same price. Located at the north end of the downtown area next to some good places to eat or buy something on Bloor Street and just a few minutes to the subway. Royal Ontaria Museum (ROM is also just a few steps away. Heard no noise. Breakfast is average. About the room? We got the suite and it was a suite :-)

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ravenjoy
Reviews.Content: Lovely restored Victorian, no elevator. Noise from the bars next door (part of the complex) and the street late at night made getting a good night's sleep a real struggle. Great if you're in Toronto for the night life; terrible if you're there for a family vacation, retreat or on business.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere of History, Academia and Youth!”
Reviews.Author: Farsante2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its proximity to the University of Toronto and central location on Bloor Street. The room was very comfortable and furnished tastefully in the style of this old Manor House. Our balcony looked out on Madison Avenue with other old manor houses now frat houses, a Tibetan Buddhist temple, business offices and a private elementary school. The included breakfast was adequate for us but disappointed German guests! Weak coffee and dry danish pastries. We ate the bagels! But the pub food at the Hotel beergarden and bar is good, inexpensive and served in cheerful surroundings. The all-day breakfast plate is super, served until 3 pm! This is a great pub to entertain guests. We stayed on weeknights and the area was quiet. However, this changes on Friday and Saturday nights when the students enjoy the good price of beer and food at the adjoining pub. Taxi drivers parked in front can also be annoyingly noisy in their conversations. (We had a taste of this on our second night!) The pluses outweigh the minuses in this lovely funky hotel. The staff are friendly and we felt at home. Bring ear plugs for weekend stays or ask for a room with a less noisy location. South side I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MishMishOttawa
Reviews.Content: Guests to our daughter's small wedding stayed at the Madison Manor - the assistance provided to my daughter prior to the wedding, the arrangements for the family and friends was friendly, flexible and attentive. Excellent location, excellent service and excellent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyBrideToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our guests stay at this great B&B for our wedding in August and we couldn't have made a better choice! The staff were so friendly and helpful when making the arrangements and they were very accommodating when changes needed to be made. The rooms were homey and unique - much better than a hotel chain. I would recommend the Madison Manor to any couple who is looking for a place for their wedding guest.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Noisy, Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: rosefam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekend in Toronto and reserved a room for two nights at the Madison Manor. Unfortunately, we were not told told when we made our reservation, that the hotel is part of a large pub complex frequented by university students. While it is a quaint Victorian style hotel, the first room we were given was right across the alley from the rear exit of hotel's pub. When I expressed concern that it might be loud at night, the management upgraded us to a lovely street facing room with a fireplace. Unfortunately, the noise level from the pub upstairs was so bad that we were unable to sleep. Things only got worse at closing time when about a hundred or more intoxicated university students poured into the street, fighting, yelling and generally behaving in a manner akin to the movie "Animal House". If getting a decent night's sleep is important, avoid this hotel at all costs. We left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Classic Victorian”
Reviews.Author: Toronto-112
Reviews.Content: This summer We decided to go with a smaller Boutique style hotel instead of our usual stay at Mega hotel chain. I can tell you this will be our choice for future hotel stays, The room we had was a beautiful suite with a very cozy homey feeling. We were a bit concerned with the noise level being next door to The Madison Avenue Pub ( great food and atmosphere), but I can tell you this was not a problem. The Location of the Manor was great for us with loads of shopping and easy access to the subway. We greatly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Madison was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaHazMan
Reviews.Content: In a big city like Toronto, where customer service is often forgotten, Madison Manor was a treasured piece of Paradise. Their staff were professional, courteous and endeavoured to make every aspect of our stay enjoyable. We booked directly through the front desk on a recommendation from some friends and found them to be organized and accommodating. As we have family in Toronto, we visit a few times a year, and will definitely be making this our 'home away from home'!!!

Reviews.Title: “next door to Frat house”
Reviews.Author: somanyplaces2see
Reviews.Content: This inn is right next door to a fraternity house. We stayed there on a Friday and Saturday night. Both nights, we were kept awake by the partying and screaming very late into the night. When I called to make a reservation, they talked me into staying in a suite for a little more money. We stayed in Rm. 201. This room is on the bottom floor in the front of the house. It was a lovely room, but like I said VERY LOUD.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: macno
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot worldwide and this hotel is one of a handful I actually look forward seeing again. I've long since ceased to frequent chain type hotels. Lovely room, well appointed room even a fireplace, friendly helpful staff , easy access to outdoors and to the heart of the city, a nice pub next door frequented by some of Canada's brightest and best university students ( where I had a chance to touch the pulse of academic energy and feel a bit younger).. a window into the life of a city. A real pleasure for those who like to experience what is unique about a city, see what makes it unique. Reminds me of another of my farourites, a small boutique hotel on the left bank near Notre Dame Cathedral - Paris Mike Cole

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Flophouse”
Reviews.Author: desertlavender
Reviews.Content: Madison Manor is a nicely appointed Victorian mansion where wealthy U of T students can crash after drinking themselves into a stupor at the pub next door. I arrived just after 11:00 and found it locked up tight, with no number to call for help. The parking spot I had reserved (for $15/night) was unavailable so I parked as directed in the alley next to the bar. Next morning I had to interrupt an important business meeting and take a taxi across town when the front desk called to warn me that my car would be towed if I didn't move it immediately. By Thursday the noise from the bar had become unbearable, and I fled in the middle of the night after running a gauntlet of heckling pub patrons and staff. My worst hotel stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jenmoloko
Reviews.Content: Our tiny, tiny room was noisy due to an old creaky air con system and being so close to a pedestrian thorouhgfare. Our hot water also failed us on more than one occasion and our safe didn't work. Some of these issues may have been resolved if there had been a receptionist available. The hotel reception is in the pub next door and often has no staff available. Late arrivals are met by the pub manager who has to be paged to check you in. All that said, the hotel location and the characterful pub next door were good. I would imagine that a bigger room on one of the upper floors would be a good base for a visit to Toronto. Avoid room 202.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming, a bit of noise”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. Our favorite aspect of this hotel was the LOCATION! Madison Manor is one short block from the intersection of the two subway lines, near the Spadina street car (excellent for getting to local clubs and shopping/restaurants on Queen Street), and within walking distance of the Bata shoe museum, ROM, and the Bloor-Yorkville shopping area. We got a decent rate on a large bedroom with fireplace and small balcony. The room and surroundings were spotlessly clean and nicely decorated. The noise from the next-door Madison Ave Pub was a minor inconvenience, but we knew that going in, and it was nice to hop next door for some World Cup games and a pint of ale! The free internet in our room was very helpful in researching where to go for dinner, etc. (we brounght our laptop). The minuses: The "King" bed is really just 2 twins attached (large crease at the center). Breakfast was ok, but the dining room (bar) smelled of old stale beer. The pub is noisy and there is a frat house / student housing on the other side of the hotel, with a large amount of trash strewn about. However, once we closed the window to our room, it was actually very quiet and the room was lovely. I would definitely recommend Madison Manor for travellers in their 20's-30's and those who are looking for a charming, clean, urban B&B who don't mind a little noise. For the price, this place is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “loved the victorian hotel near university of toronto”
Reviews.Author: kathleenPearson
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the madison avenue boutique hotel this past august because we had heard so much about it from many friends. we were not disapointed. our room even had a fireplace and kitchen. everything was spic and span clean. the big attraction was the madison avenue pub next door. it consisted of many bars on different levels of two restored victotian style homes. we easily met many people who attended the university and then stayed in the toronto area. the staff was very friendly and helpful. we plan to return the next eime we are in toronto

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Madison Manor for 6 nights in Sept 2005, and we loved it really. We found it through the web. After that we checked the reviews at TripAdvisor and I booked two rooms by email. We got very surprised when we arrived there. Everything that was promised in their website was there, a perfect location near the subway station, fine and clean rooms, good breakfast, the staff was very nice, plus the Madison Avenue Pub, which we loved it. Our staying at Madison Manor made our trip to Canada to see U2 in Toronto even more enjoyable (my friends and I are from Brazil, btw). We plan to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “felt like home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it was nice to spend a night where i felt comfortable...almost like i was at home...the decor, the atmosphere, i honestly can't remember having such a sweet sleep...this is a must if you are in the city of Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment - awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I have been to in a long time. Where to start? The incredibly rude woman who checked me in refused to allow me into my room before 3pm even though this had been previously agreed and the room was empty. When I did finally get into my basement room I rather wished I hadn't. If I stood on tiptoes on the bed and clung onto the windowsill to peer out of the window (which was 1m by 30cm at most) I could just see the gutter outside and the wheel hub of a car parked outside - not what you would call a good view. The room also smelt strongly of bleach and chlorine, giving me hope that there might be a swimming pool but no - it was just the smell from the laundry room next door. The hotel is right next to the Maddison Pub (the clue is in the name!) and so when the pub closed at 1am that night the guests were all kicked out onto the street outside where the proceeded to hang around for the next hour shouting and swearing at each other and setting off the alarm of the car parked right outside my bedroom window. The next morning when I asked the receptionist (the same incredibly rude person from the previous day ) she told me it wasn't her problem and there was nothing she could do. She told me to shut my window and turn the air con up to drown out the noise - given I couldn't even reach my window it hadn't been open anyway and this wasn't really an adequate solution. She couldn't have been less interested or apologetic if she had tried. The second (and final- thank god!) night I came back to the hotel late (to avoid the late night noise!) only to discover the cleaners (who I had had to request come to my room at 3 as they still hadn't come by then) had left my bedroom door wide open - in all likelihood it would have been open for about 8 hours. Again I complained and there was almost no apology from the same incredibly rude woman on reception. So if you want to be treated like you have no rights to privacy, peace and quiet or value for money this is the place to go but if you have any standards I would strongly recommend giving this place an incredibly wide berth - there are many many hundreds of places in Toronto that have to be better and the Maddison doesn't deserve anyone's business.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed! Our orignal reservation for our trip was at a hostel, but then we found out that for only CAN$10 more a night than a private room at a hostel, we had a small, but clean and comfortable room with a shower, tv, air conditioning and breakfast! Not only that, but we didn't rent a car, and when we got off of the subway, we literally walked a half-block, turned left and walked another block, turned another left, and we were there! The transportation in Toronto is AWESOME! (I wouldn't know what its like to navigate by car around there though...) We stayed for four nights, Wed-Sun and only faintly heard the pub next door (Nothing that the air conditioner couldn't drown out). We felt comfortable and relaxed. The breakfast isn't super fancy, but for the price we were very happy! (Simple bagels, cream cheese, juices, muffins, apples, etc...) The Madison is only about two blocks from a grocery, for those who want to save a little cash on food for their vacation. Toronto is a beautiful city, and we were able to enjoy it because of the combination of the excellent location of the Madison, and our willingness to walk and use public transportation. Its two blocks from the Bata Shoe Museum, about two blocks to the subway and street cars, however I recommend walking down beautiful and historic Bloor at least once during your stay! Most importantly, its less than a block from an espresso shop!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What to say about The Madison Manor Boutique Hotel. The place is fantastic. Our room was lovely, room 401, we had a fireplace and a small balcony for our personal use. The hotel is a beautifully renovated Victorian House complete with antiques throughout. Everything is close by and the subway is a 2 minute walk. The Pub next door was also a great place to have a drink and bite to eat. We will be back for sure in August. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a fun time away from home and came upon the Madison Manor. It was just perfect. We loved our spacious and clean room and had a great time at the pub next door. Met some very nice people and the staff were fantastic and most pleasant! Would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun time in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Madison Manor was a truly outstanding experience from the our initial booking all the way through to the check out. First and foremost the staff were exceptional in all respects. They were cordial, polite and most knowledgeable about Toronto and all that it has to offer. The location was great for both getting around (near the subway) and seeing the sights and the rooms were a nice quiet retreat at the end of a long day. The rooms were both spacious and well appointed complete with fireplaces and great beds. There is a character pub next door which serves terrific food in a clean and pleasant atmosphere. All in all it was an amazing trip punctuated by wonderful theatre and musicals and most definitely highlighted by our stay at the Madison Manor! We will be back. See you all soon and thank you for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am in Toronto often on business. I stay in nice "Cahin" hotels and find the atmosphere and Service rather sterile and unhospitable. I like the Madison Manor because: 1) It is clean. 2) It is quaint. The room itself (Room 201) is comfortable, spacious and private. 3) The restaurant / Pub next door is a great spot for a drink and a bite to eat. The staff are out of this world. A Manager there (Jim) is a complete gentleman and was always on hand to make sure that I was enjoying myself. 4) I feel at home. The price is very reasonable and I feel like I am at a "home away from home". It is the place I will always stay at from now on when I am in Toronto. Regards, Dave

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Madison Manor is THE only place to stay in Toronto. Even though the Four Seasons and Inter-Continental are nearby we would choose the Madison Manor over any other hotel. The rooms are beautifully furnished - not all the same as in chain hotels. The staff cannot be more helpful as opposed to the aloofness of other places. The location is excellent for sightseeing and acess to public transportation. And best of all for a a fine meal and some fun the Madison Pub is conviently located next door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Madison”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Toronto for a wedding and stayed at The Madison in downtown Toronto. We had a great time, and highly recommend The Madison. The price is excellent considering the location and we found the staff very gracious. We also met some great Torontonians at the Madison Pub who gave us tips on where to shop. We actually had more fun with them than at my sister's wedding. (But that's another story.)

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Madison was a great place to stay. It was tastefully decorated and impeccably clean. The location is central and within walking distance to shopping and numerous attractions with the convenience of nearby taxis and subway. We go to the theatre twice a year and always stay at the Madison. The rooms have lots of little extras such as coffee makers, internet connections, hair dryers, security safes, etc. It is right next door to the Madison Pub where we always enjoy great food and a fun time. Mary Erskine Jean Loucks Andrea Kearns Peggy Armstrong Nancy Essington

Reviews.Title: “its better than the rest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: april 09/05 as we all get older, and i am 61, it is nice to know there is still hotel rooms with a touch of class. the location was perfect for getting around and cabs easy to come by. this was our 5th visit over 4 years and we would not hesitate to go back again and again the pub next door just added to the evening of theater, with a close to home cocktail or two including a great menu of evening snacks and a "Cheers" like group of friendly people, ages i would guess from 45-73. as we own 2 Royal Lepage offices 2 hours north of toronto it is a pleasure to have a special place to go that feels like home in the center of toronto. we will be back soon. - jim and sharon gray

Reviews.Title: “The Madison is a jewel”
Reviews.Author: clminto
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of enjoying a stay at the Madison Manor Boutique Hotel last winter and found it to be a very pleasurable experience. You certainly would not describe it as your usual box hotel. The building has been beautifully restored and is very tastefully decorated. The furnishings have obviously been carefully chosen for both comfort and aesthetics. The central location is absolutely ideal if you plan to tour around the city. Toronto is such a large city, that it would be impossible to chose one location that is close to everything. However the Madison is close to many of the attractions and those that are beyond walking are easily accessable by transit, which is only minutes away. I was pleasantly surprised with the continental breakfast. They had a fairly good variety of breakfast items to choose from including sweet pastries, bagels, cereal, and boiled eggs. The rates were reasonable. The staff were friendly and helpful. I will definitely recommend the Madison as a viable alternative to the concrete towers offered up by the larger hotels.
